$interpreted: Sophie: There are so many people here. How in the world...
Joan: Master! I'm here to save you!
Ru-yi: Ohhh, nooo! No! No! No!
Sophie: Are you guys causing trouble again?
Hanbei: Not at all. Come check this out.
Clark: Maria is gambling!?

Host: LLLLLADIES AND GENTLEMEN! Welcome to the big show! Tonight, the King of Gamblers faces off with the Unbeatable Beauty! Who shall be the winner? To whom shall the legendary delicacy belong? Let's find out~
Host: And now......let's get ready to RRRRRRUMBLE!!!!!!
Maria: The chances that the next card will be an Ace is 2.3671%...
Maria: The probability that a heart will appear is less than 10.85%...
King of Gamblers: ......
Dealer: Miss Maria, it's your turn.
Maria: Lay 'em down!
Sophie: Is she doing alright?
Hutchinson: Don't worry, the lady is playing very well.
Dealer: Well—
Dealer: Ace of hearts! The winner is...
Dealer: Miss Maria!
Chu Chu: Chu Chu! Chu-Chu-Chu-Chu~!
Maria: Everyone is happy! Chu Chu is happy! Maria is happy, too!
Maria: Clark, I did well, didn't I?
Clark: You did very well, Maria. Good job.
Host: Outstanding! Since the winner has been announced, let's get to the prize—
King of Gamblers: I don't lose! She must have cheated! That prize belongs to me!
Sophie: If you're willing to bet, you'd better be ready to lose. Don't play with the big girls if you can't handle it!
Rune: Put down...the cage!
Sophie: Where's the cage? Joan's master has disappeared!
???: 1st rule of being a thief:
Joan: No matter where you are, don't forget to make a grand entrance! Don't be fooled by my stunning looks...behold!
Joan: The Thief of the Gleaming Star is here!
Unlucky Gambler: It's the Thief of the Gleaming Star!
Lucky Gambler: My wallet! Where's my wallet!?
Joan: As an offering to the stars which chose me on that fateful night, I shall take this delicacy with me!
Sophie: So that's it? She's gone?
Hanbei: I told you not to trust that wacko!
Clark: Rune, what's that? A letter.
Rune: Rune...can't read.
Sophie: Rune, let me take a look.
Sophie: "There's a secret passage to Devious' room. Cordially, Joan"...
Sophie: Why didn't she just tell us?
Clark: I think...I can explain.
Clark: I believe she was afraid that if we first went to the secret passage, we wouldn't help save her master. If it were me, I'd do the same thing.
Sophie: Why would she think such a thing? We're not bad people!
Clark: It's not about that. It's just...
Clark: Ah, yes! If we had discovered a clue about Elio in the secret passage, but we only had enough time to save one person, what would you do?
Clark: Would you choose to save Elio or Joan's master?
Clark: Just a moment ago, you were quite eager to get what you wanted?
Sophie: I......I...
Clark: Don't think about it too much. I'll take it as an apology. Anyway, Joan gave us quite the cover by causing such an uproar.
Clark: Let's not waste her good intentions.
Clark: You again? Can we finish this up already...?
Security Captain: You're not getting through.
Jahan: An old fart and a guy from the Rennaissance Fair! The two idiots I hate the most. I've wanted to do this for a long time...
Sophie: Don't think we're going to thank you for this...
Rune: Thank you.
Maria: Thank you.
Jahan: Eh??...Uh...
Jahan: Ah, yes! The world needs me, the great Jahan!
Sophie: Hey, you two! Bad! Bad! Don't be nice to people like this!
Rune: But...Sophie said that if someone helps you, then you should thank them.
Sophie: That's only if they're a good person. You don't need to thank the bad guys. I'll explain later. Let's go!
Rune: People are complicated.
Maria: People are very complicated.

Model.Text: There are so many people here. How in the world...
Master! I'm here to save you!
Ohhh, nooo! No! No! No!
Are you guys causing trouble again?
Not at all. Come check this out.
Maria is gambling!?

LLLLLADIES AND GENTLEMEN! Welcome to the big show! Tonight, the King of Gamblers faces off with the Unbeatable Beauty! Who shall be the winner? To whom shall the legendary delicacy belong? Let's find out~
And now......let's get ready to RRRRRRUMBLE!!!!!!
The chances that the next card will be an Ace is 2.3671%...
The probability that a heart will appear is less than 10.85%...
Miss Maria, it's your turn.
Lay 'em down!
Is she doing alright?
Don't worry, the lady is playing very well.
Well—
Ace of hearts! The winner is...
Miss Maria!
Chu Chu! Chu-Chu-Chu-Chu~!
Everyone is happy! Chu Chu is happy! Maria is happy, too!
Clark, I did well, didn't I?
You did very well, Maria. Good job.
Outstanding! Since the winner has been announced, let's get to the prize—
I don't lose! She must have cheated! That prize belongs to me!
If you're willing to bet, you'd better be ready to lose. Don't play with the big girls if you can't handle it!
Put down...the cage!
Where's the cage? Joan's master has disappeared!
1st rule of being a thief:
No matter where you are, don't forget to make a grand entrance! Don't be fooled by my stunning looks...behold!
The Thief of the Gleaming Star is here!
It's the Thief of the Gleaming Star!
My wallet! Where's my wallet!?
As an offering to the stars which chose me on that fateful night, I shall take this delicacy with me!
So that's it? She's gone?
I told you not to trust that wacko!
Rune, what's that? A letter.
Rune...can't read.
Rune, let me take a look.
"There's a secret passage to Devious' room. Cordially, Joan"...
Why didn't she just tell us?
I think...I can explain.
I believe she was afraid that if we first went to the secret passage, we wouldn't help save her master. If it were me, I'd do the same thing.
Why would she think such a thing? We're not bad people!
It's not about that. It's just...
Ah, yes! If we had discovered a clue about Elio in the secret passage, but we only had enough time to save one person, what would you do?
Would you choose to save Elio or Joan's master?
Just a moment ago, you were quite eager to get what you wanted?
Don't think about it too much. I'll take it as an apology. Anyway, Joan gave us quite the cover by causing such an uproar.
Let's not waste her good intentions.
You again? Can we finish this up already...?
You're not getting through.
An old fart and a guy from the Rennaissance Fair! The two idiots I hate the most. I've wanted to do this for a long time...
Don't think we're going to thank you for this...
Thank you.
Thank you.
Ah, yes! The world needs me, the great Jahan!
Hey, you two! Bad! Bad! Don't be nice to people like this!
But...Sophie said that if someone helps you, then you should thank them.
That's only if they're a good person. You don't need to thank the bad guys. I'll explain later. Let's go!
People are complicated.
People are very complicated.
